urls.title: Environment Agency launches educational tools for WOD to ‚Äòhelp marine life thrive‚Äô - Preventing Plastic Pollution
urls.description: Schools across England will mark World Ocean Day (WOD) next month (Tuesday, June 8) by exploring the journey of plastic with the Environment Agency. Primary and secondary schools are invited to view a series of online films and activities via an interactive map in advance of the event, culminating in a live question and answer sessio n with Environment Agency and World Wildlife Fund experts on the actual day. By clicking on different points of the map, students can learn how plastic pollution travels

tweets.text:
Ahead of #WorldOceanDay, we've developed an interactive tool for primary and secondary school students to show how plastic pollution travels to the ocean.

If you're a teacher, parent or guardian, read more here:
https://t.co/YvPDT5eR45 

@Plastic_EU #STEMEducation https://t.co/aU627GeQJx

Water tests at proposed White-clawed #crayfish Ark site in #Staffordshire. 

The analysis will ensure that the water chemistry is within the known parameters for this species. Also doing macro-invertebrate surveys.

Watch this space!

@StaffsWildlife @EnvAgencyMids @CrayfishIAA https://t.co/c7a44UOb1u

@EnvAgencyMids @StaffsPolice Quick to respond to that not so quick to respond to the fact that we are being gassed in our homes. Shameful. #stopthestink

@MissyDoom @SimonTagg @EnvAgencyMids @NewsNBC @StinkStopthe @AaronBell4NUL Sooo... levels of 20ppm can cause eye irritation and > 1000 ppm cause death .. erm did I read that correctly? 4610ppm recorded in May 2020 ! Is this ok because it‚Äôs Silverdale and not Surrey? #StopTheStink @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @JamesBevanEA #DEFRA @EnvAgency

Our latest #WalleysQuarry update addresses the v high H2S levels quoted in @NewsNBC‚Äôs latest letter. 

We understand these will be causing fear & distress so we want to be clear: these were levels inside landfill gas mgt pipes, before treatment. Not in the atmosphere. 

More üëá https://t.co/p0u0VlNMlr

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.

@EnvAgencyMids This monitoring does not consider the impact to health in the home where wind does not clear it. Once it enters its hard to clear. Been in my house for 2 days and struggled to clear it out even with doors open (no smell outside). It IS having a short term health impact on me.
